intro: Astragalus whitneyi var. pinosus, commonly known as the Pinosus milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to cream in color, and it produces small, hard pods that contain its seeds.
